topic.title: Math question - am I inversing this formula correctly?
topic.body:
Original formula:
`p = d * (m / (z * 2))`
However, I now need to have d. Is this correct?
`d = p / (m / (z * 2))`

I simply applied the 6 = 3 * 2 therefore 3 = 6 / 2 rule, but my calculator is giving me different answers.

1565695545_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsK.body: Yeah didn't Bill Clinton ride a helicopter to that island with him one time?

> [fantoski](#comment_70_191qyhaRxXEx1bdtG65iQvFddtXBjgo6j3): AFAIK is name was in the register of some private jet ( Or maybe helicopter ) that went ONLY to this island.

Yeah he said he never took the plane there but he didn't say anything about a helicopter so techincally speaking he didn't lie :^)

1565942944_1D6UcmziWg55aXV6TnCksXpjsFJ4g.body: Why does neutrality help the oppressor but never the victim, as quoted on the website?

> [shiok](#comment_5_1D8TyrF6WYHSWMPSwRCmDR868WxaTihFjA): because neutrality is basically weightless, strength-less and powerless. It is like the pivot of a see saw when it is balanced. It takes 2 equal effort and power to maintain that. However, it is often not the case in real life.

And a balanced society is bad because...?

1566387013_1CHaf5xV3RY8BaoknhfQBNKAYycPw.body: The nice thing about ZeroNet is that everyone can voice their own opinions. You can also mute certain people if you do not wish to see their posts. Besides that it's also possible to start your own zite similar to this.
